stakingSdk.faq1Question: How do I get an API key?
stakingSdk.faq1Answer: Visit the TBURN Developer Portal to request an API key. Read-only operations don't require authentication.
stakingSdk.faq2Question: What is the minimum stake amount?
stakingSdk.faq2Answer: Minimum stake varies by pool tier. Bronze pools start at 1,000 TBURN, while Diamond pools require 500,000 TBURN.
stakingSdk.faq3Question: How long is the unbonding period?
stakingSdk.faq3Answer: The standard unbonding period is 21 days. Early withdrawal may incur penalties depending on the pool.
stakingSdk.faq4Question: Can I stake from a hardware wallet?
stakingSdk.faq4Answer: Yes, the SDK supports Ledger and Trezor hardware wallets via Web3 provider integration.
stakingSdk.faq5Answer: You can enable auto-compound when creating a stake position. Otherwise, rewards must be manually claimed or compounded.
stakingSdk.faq6Answer: Rewards are calculated based on pool APY, stake amount, and bonus multipliers. The AI optimizer adjusts rates dynamically.

trustBased.title: Trust-Based Blockchain
trustBased.paragraph1: TBurn Chain is the world's first blockchain built on trust verification. Every project on our network undergoes rigorous 3-stage verification before listing.
trustBased.paragraph2: Our unique Trust Score system protects investors by providing transparent, real-time reliability ratings for all verified projects.
trustBased.protocolRule: Protocol-level trust enforcement ensures bad actors are automatically identified and restricted from the ecosystem.

gasOptimization.tip2: Use calldata instead of memory for read-only function parameters
gasOptimization.tip3: Cache storage variables in memory when accessed multiple times
gasOptimization.tip4: Use custom errors instead of revert strings

memoryVsStorage.title: Memory vs Storage
memoryVsStorage.desc: Use memory for temporary data and storage for persistent state to optimize gas usage.

shortRevert.title: Short Revert Messages
shortRevert.desc: Use custom errors instead of long revert strings to save deployment and execution gas.

useEvents.title: Use Events for Logging
useEvents.desc: Emit events instead of storing data when historical access via logs is sufficient.

variablePacking.desc: Pack multiple variables into single storage slots to minimize storage costs.

v4-mainnet-launch.title: TBURN v7.0 Mainnet Launch: A New Era of Blockchain Innovation
v4-mainnet-launch.description: After months of rigorous testing, TBURN v7.0 mainnet is now live with revolutionary AI-enhanced consensus and enterprise-grade features.
v4-mainnet-launch.author: TBURN Core Team

content.0: We are thrilled to announce that TBURN v7.0 mainnet has officially launched, marking a significant milestone in our journey to revolutionize blockchain technology. This release represents the culmination of over two years of research and development.
content.2: AI-Enhanced Committee BFT Consensus: Our proprietary consensus mechanism combines traditional Byzantine Fault Tolerance with advanced AI algorithms for optimal validator selection and network security.
content.3: Dynamic Sharding System: The network now supports automatic load balancing across multiple shards, enabling unprecedented scalability without sacrificing decentralization.
content.4: Triple-Band AI Orchestration: Three independent AI systems (GPT-5, Claude, Llama 4) work in harmony to optimize network operations, from transaction routing to resource allocation.
content.5: Enterprise Token Standards (TBC-20, TBC-721, TBC-1155): Our enhanced token standards provide quantum-resistant security and built-in compliance features for institutional adoption.
content.6: The mainnet launch includes a comprehensive DeFi ecosystem with DEX/AMM, lending protocols, liquid staking, NFT marketplace, and cross-chain bridge capabilities.
content.7: We invite developers, validators, and users to join us in building the future of decentralized finance on TBURN v7.0.

triple-band-ai-revealed.title: Triple-Band AI Architecture Revealed: The Future of Blockchain Intelligence
triple-band-ai-revealed.description: An in-depth technical exploration of how TBURN leverages three AI systems for optimal blockchain performance.
triple-band-ai-revealed.author: Dr. Sarah Chen

content.0: The TBURN v7.0 AI Orchestration system represents a breakthrough in blockchain technology, combining multiple AI providers for redundancy, accuracy, and optimal decision-making.
content.2: Primary Band (GPT-5): Handles complex analytical tasks including validator trust scoring, anomaly detection, and predictive maintenance.
content.3: Secondary Band (Claude): Specializes in code analysis, smart contract auditing, and natural language processing for governance proposals.
content.4: Tertiary Band (Llama 4): Provides high-throughput, low-latency processing for real-time transaction routing and load balancing decisions.
content.5: Cross-Band Interaction: When a decision requires high confidence, all three AI systems independently analyze the situation. A consensus mechanism then combines their outputs, weighting each based on historical accuracy for similar decision types.
content.6: Feedback Learning System: Every AI decision is tracked and evaluated against actual outcomes. This continuous feedback loop enables the system to improve over time, with accuracy metrics currently exceeding 99.7% for validator selection decisions.
content.7: The result is a self-improving, fault-tolerant AI layer that enhances every aspect of blockchain operations.

global-partnership-expansion.title: Global Partnership Expansion: TBURN Joins Forces with Industry Leaders
global-partnership-expansion.description: Strategic partnerships announced to accelerate TBURN ecosystem growth and global adoption.
global-partnership-expansion.author: Business Development Team

content.0: TBURN is proud to announce a series of strategic partnerships that will accelerate our ecosystem growth and bring blockchain technology to millions of new users worldwide.
content.2: Enterprise Integration Partners: Leading financial institutions and technology companies have committed to integrating TBURN's enterprise solutions.
content.3: Developer Ecosystem: Major development studios and blockchain tool providers are building on TBURN.
content.4: Infrastructure Partners: Cloud providers and data center operators are supporting our global node network.
content.5: Regional Expansion: These partnerships enable TBURN to establish presence in key markets across Asia, Europe, and the Americas, with localized support and compliance frameworks.
content.6: Developer Resources: Our partners are contributing to comprehensive developer resources, including SDKs, documentation, and training programs.
content.7: We're excited about the opportunities these partnerships create for our community and the broader blockchain ecosystem.

staking-program-details.title: Staking Program Details: Maximize Your TBURN Rewards
staking-program-details.description: Complete guide to TBURN staking tiers, rewards, and how to maximize your returns.
staking-program-details.author: TBURN Economics Team

content.0: The TBURN staking program offers multiple ways to earn rewards while supporting network security. Here's everything you need to know.
content.2: Bronze Tier: Minimum 1,000 TBURN - 8% base APY
content.3: Silver Tier: Minimum 10,000 TBURN - 12% base APY + governance rights
content.4: Gold Tier: Minimum 100,000 TBURN - 18% base APY + priority validator selection
content.5: Platinum Tier: Minimum 1,000,000 TBURN - 25% base APY + all benefits
content.6: Lock Period Bonuses: Longer lock periods provide additional APY bonuses up to 50% extra.
content.7: Auto-Compounding: Enable auto-compounding to automatically reinvest your rewards and maximize returns.
content.8: Getting Started: Visit the TBURN staking dashboard to begin earning rewards today.

trust-score-deep-dive.title: Trust Score Deep Dive: How TBURN's AI Evaluates Network Security
trust-score-deep-dive.description: Comprehensive explanation of the AI-powered Trust Score system that ensures network integrity.
trust-score-deep-dive.author: Security Team

content.0: The TBURN Trust Score system is a revolutionary approach to network security, leveraging AI to continuously evaluate and score every participant in the ecosystem.
content.2: Real-time Monitoring: AI systems continuously analyze validator behavior, transaction patterns, and network contributions.
content.3: Multi-factor Analysis: Scores consider uptime, response time, block production accuracy, governance participation, and historical reliability.
content.4: Dynamic Adjustment: Trust scores update in real-time based on recent activity, with more recent actions weighted more heavily.
content.5: Trust Score Impact: Higher trust scores unlock benefits like priority transaction processing, reduced fees, and enhanced governance voting power.
content.6: Maintaining High Scores: Consistent uptime, timely block production, and active governance participation are key factors in maintaining high trust scores.
content.7: The Trust Score system ensures that the most reliable participants are rewarded, creating a self-reinforcing security mechanism.

sdk-2-released.title: TBURN SDK 2.0 Released: Build Faster with New Developer Tools
sdk-2-released.description: The new SDK version brings improved APIs, TypeScript support, and comprehensive documentation.
sdk-2-released.author: Developer Relations

content.0: We're excited to announce the release of TBURN SDK 2.0, featuring significant improvements for developers building on our platform.
content.2: Full TypeScript Support: Complete type definitions for all SDK functions and objects.
content.3: Simplified APIs: Streamlined interfaces for common operations like transactions, staking, and smart contract interactions.
content.4: React Hooks: Pre-built hooks for easy integration with React applications.
content.5: Better Error Handling: Comprehensive error types and messages for easier debugging.
content.6: Getting Started: Install with npm: npm install @tburn/sdk
content.7: Documentation: Visit our developer portal for comprehensive guides, API references, and example projects.
content.8: The SDK 2.0 represents our commitment to making TBURN development accessible and enjoyable.

quantum-resistant-cryptography.title: Quantum-Resistant Cryptography: Securing TBURN's Future
quantum-resistant-cryptography.description: How TBURN implements quantum-resistant algorithms to protect against future threats.
quantum-resistant-cryptography.author: Cryptography Team

content.0: As quantum computing advances, traditional cryptographic methods face potential vulnerabilities. TBURN is proactively addressing this with quantum-resistant implementations.
content.2: Hybrid Cryptography: Combining traditional and post-quantum algorithms for immediate security and future-proofing.
content.3: NIST-Approved Standards: Implementing cryptographic algorithms approved by NIST for post-quantum security.
content.4: Gradual Migration: Phased rollout of quantum-resistant features to ensure stability.
content.6: Transaction Signatures: All new transactions use quantum-resistant signature schemes.
content.7: Key Exchange: Secure key exchange protocols that resist quantum attacks.
content.8: Hash Functions: Multi-hash system with quantum-resistant options.
content.9: This proactive approach ensures TBURN remains secure even as quantum computing capabilities evolve.

tburn-dex-beta.title: TBURN DEX Beta Launch: Decentralized Trading is Here
tburn-dex-beta.description: The TBURN decentralized exchange is now in beta with multiple AMM curve types and AI-optimized routing.
tburn-dex-beta.author: DeFi Team

content.0: The TBURN DEX beta is now live, bringing decentralized trading to our ecosystem with advanced features and AI optimization.
content.2: Multiple AMM Types: Constant product, stable swap, and concentrated liquidity pools.
content.3: AI-Optimized Routing: Smart routing finds the best path across all pools for optimal swap rates.
content.4: MEV Protection: Built-in protection against sandwich attacks and front-running.
content.5: Low Fees: Competitive trading fees with discounts for high-volume traders.
content.6: Liquidity Provision: Earn fees by providing liquidity to pools. Our auto-compounding feature maximizes your returns.
content.7: Getting Started: Connect your wallet and start trading on the TBURN DEX today. Full documentation is available in our developer portal.
content.8: Join our community channels to provide feedback and help shape the future of decentralized trading on TBURN.

1.question: What is TBURN?
1.answer: TBURN is a next-generation Layer 1 blockchain that processes 520,000 TPS with 100ms block time. It uses an AI-enhanced BFT consensus mechanism to provide high security and scalability, with a deflationary token economic model aimed at sustainable value creation.

2.question: How do I get started with TBURN?
2.answer: 1) Install a supported wallet (MetaMask, Rabby, Trust Wallet, etc.). 2) Connect to TBURN mainnet. 3) Purchase or receive TB tokens. 4) Manage your assets and use DeFi services from the wallet dashboard.

3.question: Where can I buy TB tokens?
3.answer: TB tokens can be purchased on TBURN's built-in DEX, partner exchanges, or through cross-chain bridges. You can swap directly on the DEX page or bring assets from other chains via the bridge.

4.question: What is the TBURN wallet address format?
4.answer: TBURN uses Bech32m format addresses. All addresses start with "tb1" and consist of exactly 41 characters (e.g., tb1edmprvaftt65lkp2x6v8fmjvst5spfruj47kwm). This format follows the BIP-350 standard with built-in error detection.

5.question: What are the transaction fees?
5.answer: TBURN's base network fee is approximately 0.0001 TB. Additionally, all transfers have a 0.5% burn fee that permanently burns tokens. This deflationary mechanism contributes to maintaining token value.

6.question: What is the difference between TBURN mainnet and testnet?
6.answer: Mainnet is the production network where TB tokens with real value are used. Testnet is used for development and testing purposes, and test tokens have no value. Developers should deploy and test smart contracts on testnet before deploying to mainnet.

7.question: What is TBURN Explorer?
7.answer: TBURN Explorer (Scan) is a blockchain explorer where you can view blocks, transactions, wallets, and smart contracts. It's a public tool for transparently checking real-time network status, validator information, and token movements.

8.question: What are the future plans in the roadmap?
8.answer: TBURN's roadmap includes continuous network expansion, new DeFi protocol integration, cross-chain bridge expansion, AI feature enhancement, and gaming/NFT ecosystem growth. Detailed milestones can be found on the roadmap page.

9.question: Where can I read the TBURN whitepaper?
9.answer: The TBURN whitepaper is available in the Learn section of the official website. It contains detailed explanations of technical architecture, consensus mechanism, tokenomics, and governance model.

10.question: How can I join the TBURN community?
10.answer: Through the Community Hub, you can check announcements, events, and news, and interact with other users. You can vote on governance proposals and participate in airdrops and campaigns to earn rewards.

11.question: Which wallets support TBURN?
11.answer: TBURN supports MetaMask, Rabby Wallet, Trust Wallet, Coinbase Wallet, and Ledger hardware wallets. You can use any EVM-compatible wallet by adding the TBURN network.

12.question: How do I connect my wallet to TBURN network?
12.answer: Click the "Connect Wallet" button on the wallet dashboard and select your preferred wallet. The network will be added automatically, and if manual setup is needed, you can find network information on the RPC page.

13.question: How do I transfer tokens to another wallet?
13.answer: In the Wallet & Transfer tab, enter the recipient address (41 characters starting with tb1) and set the amount. Burn fee (0.5%) and network fee are automatically calculated and displayed. Click the transfer button to complete the transaction.

14.question: Why is my wallet balance not updating?
14.answer: It may be due to network delay or cache issues. Try refreshing the page or reconnecting your wallet. You can verify if the transaction is confirmed on the Explorer. If the issue persists, try a different RPC endpoint.

15.question: Can I use a hardware wallet?
15.answer: Ledger hardware wallets are fully supported. You can install the TBURN app through Ledger Live and connect it with MetaMask. Hardware wallets provide the highest level of security.

16.question: What can I do on the wallet dashboard?
16.answer: On the wallet dashboard, you can view portfolio overview, asset balances, and recent transactions. It's the central hub for all blockchain activities including staking, DEX swaps, NFT browsing, and DeFi services.

17.question: How do I claim unclaimed rewards?
17.answer: You can view claimable rewards in the Rewards section of the dashboard. Click the "Claim All" button to claim staking, mining, and event rewards at once. They will be reflected in your wallet after transaction confirmation.

18.question: How do I check transaction status?
18.answer: Search for the transaction hash in Explorer to check status, confirmation count, gas usage, and block information. You can also view transaction history in the Recent Activity section of the wallet dashboard.

19.question: What happens if I don't have enough gas?
19.answer: If you don't have enough gas (TB), the transaction will fail. Make sure you have sufficient TB balance before transferring. You can check estimated gas fees in advance using the Transaction Simulator.

20.question: How do I use the on-ramp (Fiat-to-Crypto)?
20.answer: On the Network Ramp page, you can purchase TB tokens directly using credit cards, bank transfers, etc. Through partner payment services, you can easily purchase using KRW and major currencies.

21.question: What is staking?
21.answer: Staking is delegating TB tokens to validators to contribute to network security and earn rewards. Staked tokens participate in network consensus, and rewards are distributed regularly based on APY.

22.question: What is the minimum staking amount?
22.answer: For regular delegation, staking starts from a minimum of 10 TB. To participate directly as a validator, you need between 1,000 TB to 100,000 TB depending on the tier.

23.question: How are staking rewards calculated?
23.answer: Rewards are calculated based on staking amount, validator performance, and network participation rate. Current base APY is approximately 8-15%, and detailed breakdown can be viewed on the Rewards page.

24.question: How long does unstaking take?
24.answer: There is a 21-day unbonding period after requesting unstaking. During this period, tokens are locked and no rewards are earned. Once unbonding is complete, tokens are returned to your wallet.

25.question: How should I choose a validator?
25.answer: Consider uptime, commission rate, total delegation, and self-stake amount. It's advisable to choose reliable validators with high uptime and low commission. You can compare detailed information on the Validators page.

26.question: What is slashing?
26.answer: Slashing is a penalty where a portion of staked tokens is cut when validators engage in malicious behavior (double signing, extended offline periods). Choosing reliable validators can reduce slashing risk.

27.question: What is liquid staking?
27.answer: Liquid staking is a way to maintain liquidity while staking. When you stake TB, you receive stTB tokens that can be used in DeFi while simultaneously earning staking rewards.

28.question: Where can I use stTB tokens?
28.answer: stTB can be traded on DEX, used as collateral in lending protocols, and deposited in yield farming pools. You can earn dual yields from both staking rewards and DeFi returns.

29.question: What is the Staking SDK?
29.answer: The Staking SDK is a tool for developers to integrate staking functionality into their applications. It supports JavaScript/TypeScript and allows programmatic implementation of delegation, unstaking, and reward claiming.

30.question: How do I apply to become a validator?
30.answer: Complete the 3-step application in the Validator Application System: 1) Basic requirements verification and document submission, 2) Technical infrastructure verification, 3) Staking and final approval. Requirements vary by tier (Bronze, Silver, Gold).

31.question: What is TBURN DEX?
31.answer: TBURN DEX is a decentralized exchange where you can directly swap TB tokens with other assets. It operates on an AMM (Automated Market Maker) model, and you can earn trading fees by participating in liquidity pools.

32.question: How do I swap tokens?
32.answer: On the DEX page, select the token pair to exchange and enter the amount. Expected receipt amount and slippage are displayed. Click the swap button to execute the trade. Wallet approval is required.

33.question: What is a liquidity pool?
33.answer: A liquidity pool is depositing two tokens in equal ratios to enable trades for other users. Liquidity providers receive a portion of trading fees generated from the pool as rewards.

34.question: How does lending work?
34.answer: Deposit assets in the lending protocol to earn interest. You can also provide collateral and borrow other assets. When borrowing, pay attention to collateral ratio (LTV) and liquidation threshold.

35.question: What is liquidation?
35.answer: Liquidation occurs when collateral value falls below a certain ratio relative to the loan. Collateral is forcibly sold to repay the loan, and a liquidation penalty applies. Keep your collateral ratio at safe levels.

36.question: What is yield farming?
36.answer: Yield farming is depositing LP tokens or assets in specific pools to receive additional token rewards. It offers high APY but also carries risks like impermanent loss.

37.question: What is impermanent loss?
37.answer: When token prices in a liquidity pool change, losses compared to simply holding can occur. The loss disappears if prices return to original levels, hence "impermanent".

38.question: What should I be careful about when borrowing?
38.answer: Maintain collateral ratio (LTV) above safe margin. There is liquidation risk due to market volatility. Always check interest rates, liquidation thresholds, and collateral requirements.

39.question: What is a flash loan?
39.answer: Flash loans are uncollateralized loans borrowed and repaid within a single transaction. Used for arbitrage, collateral swaps, etc. If the transaction fails, the loan is also cancelled.

40.question: What is a cross-chain bridge?
40.answer: Moving assets from other blockchains (Ethereum, BSC, Polygon, etc.) to TBURN or vice versa. Check supported chains and fees on the Bridge page.

41.question: How do I purchase NFTs?
41.answer: Browse collections on the NFT Marketplace and select your desired NFT. Fixed price purchase or auction bidding is available. Payment is made with TB tokens and gas fee is required.

42.question: How do I create and sell NFTs?
42.answer: Click "Create" on the NFT Marketplace to upload images/media and set metadata. After paying minting fee, you can list for sale. Choose between fixed price or auction method.

43.question: What is NFT Launchpad?
43.answer: NFT Launchpad is a platform where new NFT collections are first released. Registering on the whitelist allows minting at discounted prices before public sale.

44.question: What is GameFi?
44.answer: GameFi combines gaming with DeFi, earning cryptocurrency and NFTs while playing games. Access partner games and check rewards on the TBURN GameFi Hub.

45.question: How do I earn in GameFi?
45.answer: Earn through completing in-game quests, PvP victories, item trading, NFT sales, etc. Each game has different tokenomics, so check each game's reward structure.

46.question: What should I be careful about when using the bridge?
46.answer: Verify correct receiving address, confirm supported tokens, and be aware that transfers may take longer during network congestion. We recommend testing with a small amount for your first bridge.

47.question: What is an RPC endpoint?
47.answer: RPC (Remote Procedure Call) endpoint is the connection point for communicating with blockchain nodes. Wallets and dApps use it to send transactions and query data.

48.question: What is TBURN's TPS?
48.answer: TBURN can process 520,000 transactions per second (TPS). This is achieved through sharding and parallel processing technology, with 100ms block time providing fast finality.

49.question: What is BFT consensus?
49.answer: BFT (Byzantine Fault Tolerant) is a consensus mechanism where the network operates normally even if some nodes are malicious or fail. TBURN uses AI-enhanced BFT for improved security and efficiency.

50.question: What is sharding?
50.answer: Sharding is a scaling technology that divides the blockchain into multiple shards for parallel processing. Each shard processes transactions independently, increasing overall network throughput.

51.question: What is AI orchestration?
51.answer: AI orchestration integrates multiple AI models (Gemini, Claude, ChatGPT, Grok) to automate network optimization, burn rate adjustment, security threat detection, and more.

52.question: What are the validator requirements?
52.answer: Requirements vary by validator tier: Bronze (1,000 TB), Silver (10,000 TB), Gold (100,000 TB). Stable server infrastructure, high uptime, and technical capability are needed.

53.question: What is a cross-shard transaction?
53.answer: Transactions between accounts on different shards. Coordinated through the beacon chain, may require slightly longer finalization time than regular transactions.

54.question: Where can I check network status?
54.answer: Check current block height, TPS, active validators, shard status, and network health in real-time on the Network Status page.

55.question: Where can I get testnet RPC?
55.answer: Check testnet connection information on the Testnet RPC page. Chain ID, RPC URL, explorer URL, and faucet links are provided.

56.question: Can I run my own node?
56.answer: Anyone can run a full node. Check node installation guide, hardware requirements, and configuration methods in developer documentation.

57.question: How is gas price determined?
57.answer: Gas price is dynamically adjusted based on network congestion. You can add a priority tip to the base gas price to request faster processing.

58.question: What is the membership system?
58.answer: The membership system assigns tiers based on user activity (Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, Diamond). Higher tiers receive more benefits and fee discounts.

59.question: What is Trust Score?
59.answer: Trust Score is a reputation score calculated based on on-chain activity, staking history, governance participation, etc. Higher scores provide better conditions and opportunities.

60.question: How do I get governance voting rights?
60.answer: Stake TB tokens to get governance voting rights. Voting power is determined proportionally to staked amount. Vote on active proposals on the Governance page.

61.question: What is a smart contract?
61.answer: A smart contract is a program deployed on blockchain that executes automatically. When conditions are met, contracts execute automatically without intermediaries, ensuring reliability and transparency.

62.question: What is the TBC-20 token standard?
62.answer: TBC-20 is TBURN's token standard, compatible with ERC-20. It supports additional features like burn, freeze, and metadata extensions beyond basic functions.

63.question: How do I deploy a smart contract?
63.answer: Write contracts in Solidity or Rust and compile with TBURN compiler. Deploy on the Smart Contracts page or programmatically via SDK/CLI.

64.question: What is the Transaction Simulator?
64.answer: The Transaction Simulator is a tool to preview transaction results before actual execution. You can identify expected gas fees, state changes, and potential errors in advance.

65.question: Where can I get API keys?
65.answer: Create new API keys on the API Keys page. You can set permissions and usage limits per key, and monitor usage on the dashboard.

66.question: What SDK options are available?
66.answer: JavaScript/TypeScript, Python, Rust, and Go SDKs are provided. Use all blockchain functions programmatically including wallet connection, transaction sending, and smart contract interaction.

67.question: How do I use CLI tools?
67.answer: Install TBURN CLI to perform account management, transaction sending, and smart contract deployment from terminal. Check installation and command guide in developer documentation.

68.question: How do I migrate from EVM?
68.answer: TBURN is EVM compatible, so existing Solidity contracts can be deployed with minimal modifications. Check step-by-step methods in the EVM Migration guide.

69.question: What is WebSocket API?
69.answer: WebSocket API allows receiving real-time blocks, transactions, and events in streaming format. Used when dApps need real-time updates.

70.question: Where is the developer documentation?
70.answer: Find complete documentation, API reference, tutorials, and code examples in the Developer Hub. Get started quickly with the Quickstart guide.

71.question: Where can I find code examples?
71.answer: Find example code for various use cases including transaction sending, token issuance, NFT minting, and DeFi integration on the Code Examples page.

72.question: What are the REST API endpoints?
72.answer: Query blocks, transactions, accounts, and token information via REST API. Check complete endpoint list and example requests in API documentation.

73.question: What is smart contract verification?
73.answer: Smart contract verification proves that deployed bytecode matches the source code. Verified contracts have source code visible in Explorer, increasing transparency.

74.question: How do I interact with contracts?
74.answer: Call functions directly through Read/Write tabs of verified contracts in Explorer. Or interact programmatically using SDKs.

75.question: What are event logs?
75.answer: Event logs are records generated when smart contracts execute. Used to track activities like token transfers, swaps, and minting.

76.question: What is ABI?
76.answer: ABI (Application Binary Interface) is an interface definition for interacting with smart contracts. Defines function names, parameters, and return types to enable contract calls.

77.question: How do I estimate gas?
77.answer: Calculate estimated gas using SDK's estimateGas function or Transaction Simulator. More complex contract calls require more gas.

78.question: What is a nonce?
78.answer: Nonce is a sequential number representing the count of transactions sent from an account. Ensures transaction order and prevents double spending.

79.question: What is a proxy contract?
79.answer: A proxy contract is an upgradeable smart contract pattern. Separated from logic contracts, allowing logic changes while maintaining contract address and state.

80.question: How do I set up the development environment?
80.answer: Install Node.js and TBURN SDK and connect to testnet RPC. Check step-by-step environment setup and sample projects in the Installation guide.

81.question: Getting started with dApp development
81.answer: Learn basics of wallet connection, transaction sending, and smart contract calls in the Quickstart guide. Follow code examples and tutorials to build your first dApp.

82.question: What debugging tools are available?
82.answer: Check execution traces in transaction details on Explorer. Analyze failure causes with Transaction Simulator, and use SDK logging for local development.

83.question: How do I get a security audit?
83.answer: Smart contract security audits can be obtained through partner audit firms. We recommend getting a security audit before launchpad or main protocol deployment.

84.question: Where can I get test tokens?
84.answer: You can get free test TB from the testnet faucet. Check the Testnet RPC page for faucet links and usage. Requests can be made every 24 hours.

85.question: What are Actions & Blinks?
85.answer: Actions & Blinks is a feature to share blockchain operations as URLs. Complex transactions can be shared and executed with a single link, simplifying user onboarding.

86.question: What are token extensions?
86.answer: TBC-20 tokens can be extended with additional features (freezing, transfer restrictions, interest, metadata). Used for security tokens or special-purpose tokens requiring compliance.

87.question: What are permissioned blockchain solutions?
87.answer: Enterprises can build private networks with access control. Based on TBURN technology, operate enterprise blockchains accessible only to authorized participants.

88.question: What are Commerce solutions?
88.answer: An integrated solution for accepting TB payments in online/offline stores. Provides payment API, POS integration, settlement system, and tax calculation tools.

89.question: What financial solutions are available?
89.answer: Provides custody, trading, payment, and asset management solutions for financial institutions. Compliance tools and audit trail features meet institutional requirements.

90.question: What AI features are available?
90.answer: Provides AI-based burn optimization, governance analysis, bridge risk assessment, anomaly detection, and validator scheduling. Multiple AI models (Gemini, Claude, ChatGPT, Grok) are integrated.

91.question: What are enterprise use cases?
91.answer: Provides enterprise blockchain use cases including supply chain tracking, digital certification, data integrity verification, and internal token systems. Dedicated support and SLA provided.

92.question: What is tokenization?
92.answer: Converting real assets (real estate, art, commodities) into blockchain tokens. Enables fractional ownership, increased liquidity, and 24/7 trading.

93.question: Where can I check news and announcements?
93.answer: Check the Community News page for latest updates, partnership announcements, and technical improvements. Subscribe to the newsletter to receive updates via email.

94.question: How do I participate in events?
94.answer: Check the Community Events page for ongoing airdrops, campaigns, and meetup information. Meet participation requirements and register to receive rewards.

95.question: How do I make governance proposals?
95.answer: Staking a certain amount of TB allows you to create governance proposals. Write content according to the proposal format and submit for community voting.

96.question: What can I do on the Community Hub?
96.answer: On the Community Hub, you can discuss with other users, introduce projects, and share feedback. You can also check official announcements and development updates.

97.question: How do I keep my assets safe?
97.answer: 1) Use hardware wallet, 2) Never share private key/seed phrase, 3) Beware of phishing sites, 4) Use only official URLs, 5) Enable 2FA. Store large assets in cold wallets.

98.question: How do I identify scams?
98.answer: Trust only official channels. Requests for private keys or seed phrases are 100% scams. Beware of messages creating urgency like "free tokens" or "urgent upgrade".

99.question: What is the total supply of TB tokens?
99.answer: Initial supply and current circulating supply of TB tokens can be checked on the Tokenomics page. Due to the burn mechanism, total supply continuously decreases.

100.question: How does the burn mechanism work?
100.answer: A 0.5% burn fee applies to all transfers, permanently burning that amount. Part of network fees are also burned. This deflationary model supports token value.

q1.question: What is TBURN?
q1.answer: TBURN is a next-generation Layer 1 blockchain that processes 520,000 TPS with 100ms block time. It uses an AI-enhanced BFT consensus mechanism to provide high security and scalability, with a deflationary token economic model aimed at sustainable value creation.

q2.question: How do I get started with TBURN?
q2.answer: 1) Install a supported wallet (MetaMask, Rabby, Trust Wallet, etc.). 2) Connect to TBURN mainnet. 3) Purchase or receive TB tokens. 4) Manage your assets and use DeFi services from the wallet dashboard.

q3.question: Where can I buy TB tokens?
q3.answer: TB tokens can be purchased on TBURN's built-in DEX, partner exchanges, or through cross-chain bridges. You can swap directly on the DEX page or bring assets from other chains via the bridge.

q4.question: What is the TBURN wallet address format?
q4.answer: TBURN uses Bech32m format addresses. All addresses start with "tb1" and consist of exactly 41 characters (e.g., tb1edmprvaftt65lkp2x6v8fmjvst5spfruj47kwm). This format follows the BIP-350 standard with built-in error detection.

q5.question: What are the transaction fees?
q5.answer: TBURN's base network fee is approximately 0.0001 TB. Additionally, all transfers have a 0.5% burn fee that permanently burns tokens. This deflationary mechanism contributes to maintaining token value.

q6.question: What is the difference between TBURN mainnet and testnet?
q6.answer: Mainnet is the production network where TB tokens with real value are used. Testnet is used for development and testing purposes, and test tokens have no value. Developers should deploy and test smart contracts on testnet before deploying to mainnet.

q7.question: What is TBURN Explorer?
q7.answer: TBURN Explorer (Scan) is a blockchain explorer where you can view blocks, transactions, wallets, and smart contracts. It's a public tool for transparently checking real-time network status, validator information, and token movements.

q8.question: What are the future plans in the roadmap?
q8.answer: TBURN's roadmap includes continuous network expansion, new DeFi protocol integration, cross-chain bridge expansion, AI feature enhancement, and gaming/NFT ecosystem growth. Detailed milestones can be found on the roadmap page.

q9.question: Where can I read the TBURN whitepaper?
q9.answer: The TBURN whitepaper is available in the Learn section of the official website. It contains detailed explanations of technical architecture, consensus mechanism, tokenomics, and governance model.

q10.question: How can I join the TBURN community?
q10.answer: Through the Community Hub, you can check announcements, events, and news, and interact with other users. You can vote on governance proposals and participate in airdrops and campaigns to earn rewards.

q11.question: Which wallets support TBURN?
q11.answer: TBURN supports MetaMask, Rabby Wallet, Trust Wallet, Coinbase Wallet, and Ledger hardware wallets. You can use any EVM-compatible wallet by adding the TBURN network.

q12.question: How do I connect my wallet to TBURN network?
q12.answer: Click the "Connect Wallet" button on the wallet dashboard and select your preferred wallet. The network will be added automatically, and if manual setup is needed, you can find network information on the RPC page.

q13.question: How do I transfer tokens to another wallet?
q13.answer: In the Wallet & Transfer tab, enter the recipient address (41 characters starting with tb1) and set the amount. Burn fee (0.5%) and network fee are automatically calculated and displayed. Click the transfer button to complete the transaction.

q14.question: Why is my wallet balance not updating?
q14.answer: It may be due to network delay or cache issues. Try refreshing the page or reconnecting your wallet. You can verify if the transaction is confirmed on the Explorer. If the issue persists, try a different RPC endpoint.

q15.question: Can I use a hardware wallet?
q15.answer: Ledger hardware wallets are fully supported. You can install the TBURN app through Ledger Live and connect it with MetaMask. Hardware wallets provide the highest level of security.

q16.question: What can I do on the wallet dashboard?
q16.answer: On the wallet dashboard, you can view portfolio overview, asset balances, and recent transactions. It's the central hub for all blockchain activities including staking, DEX swaps, NFT browsing, and DeFi services.

q17.question: How do I claim unclaimed rewards?
q17.answer: You can view claimable rewards in the Rewards section of the dashboard. Click the "Claim All" button to claim staking, mining, and event rewards at once. They will be reflected in your wallet after transaction confirmation.

q18.question: How do I check transaction status?
q18.answer: Search for the transaction hash in Explorer to check status, confirmation count, gas usage, and block information. You can also view transaction history in the Recent Activity section of the wallet dashboard.

q19.question: What happens if I don't have enough gas?
q19.answer: If you don't have enough gas (TB), the transaction will fail. Make sure you have sufficient TB balance before transferring. You can check estimated gas fees in advance using the Transaction Simulator.

q20.question: How do I use the on-ramp (Fiat-to-Crypto)?
q20.answer: On the Network Ramp page, you can purchase TB tokens directly using credit cards, bank transfers, etc. Through partner payment services, you can easily purchase using KRW and major currencies.

q21.question: What is staking?
q21.answer: Staking is delegating TB tokens to validators to contribute to network security and earn rewards. Staked tokens participate in network consensus, and rewards are distributed regularly based on APY.

q22.question: What is the minimum staking amount?
q22.answer: For regular delegation, staking starts from a minimum of 10 TB. To participate directly as a validator, you need between 1,000 TB to 100,000 TB depending on the tier.

q23.question: How are staking rewards calculated?
q23.answer: Rewards are calculated based on staking amount, validator performance, and network participation rate. Current base APY is approximately 8-15%, and detailed breakdown can be viewed on the Rewards page.

q24.question: How long does unstaking take?
q24.answer: There is a 21-day unbonding period after requesting unstaking. During this period, tokens are locked and no rewards are earned. Once unbonding is complete, tokens are returned to your wallet.

q25.question: How should I choose a validator?
q25.answer: Consider uptime, commission rate, total delegation, and self-stake amount. It's advisable to choose reliable validators with high uptime and low commission. You can compare detailed information on the Validators page.

q26.question: What is slashing?
q26.answer: Slashing is a penalty where a portion of staked tokens is cut when validators engage in malicious behavior (double signing, extended offline periods). Choosing reliable validators can reduce slashing risk.

q27.question: What is liquid staking?
q27.answer: Liquid staking is a way to maintain liquidity while staking. When you stake TB, you receive stTB tokens that can be used in DeFi while simultaneously earning staking rewards.

q28.question: Where can I use stTB tokens?
q28.answer: stTB can be traded on DEX, used as collateral in lending protocols, and deposited in yield farming pools. You can earn dual yields from both staking rewards and DeFi returns.

q29.question: What is the Staking SDK?
q29.answer: The Staking SDK is a tool for developers to integrate staking functionality into their applications. It supports JavaScript/TypeScript and allows programmatic implementation of delegation, unstaking, and reward claiming.

q30.question: How do I apply to become a validator?
q30.answer: Complete the 3-step application in the Validator Application System: 1) Basic requirements verification and document submission, 2) Technical infrastructure verification, 3) Staking and final approval. Requirements vary by tier (Bronze, Silver, Gold).

q31.question: What is TBURN DEX?
q31.answer: TBURN DEX is a decentralized exchange where you can swap TB tokens and other assets directly. It operates using AMM (Automated Market Maker), and you can earn trading fees by participating in liquidity pools.

q32.question: How do I swap tokens on DEX?
q32.answer: Select the token pair to swap on the DEX page. Enter the amount and the exchange ratio is automatically calculated. Set slippage and click the swap button. Confirm the transaction in your wallet to complete.

q33.question: What is slippage?
q33.answer: Slippage is the difference between the expected price and actual execution price during a swap. It mainly occurs when large orders affect pool liquidity. You can set a slippage tolerance to control acceptable price change.

q34.question: How do I provide liquidity?
q34.answer: You provide a pair of tokens (e.g., TB-USDT) to a liquidity pool. LP tokens are received, and trading fees are earned proportionally. IL (Impermanent Loss) can occur when prices fluctuate.

q35.question: What is impermanent loss?
q35.answer: When one token's price changes significantly compared to the other in a liquidity pool, the value of your deposited assets may be less than if you simply held them. However, trading fee rewards can offset this loss.

q36.question: What is lending?
q36.answer: On the Lending page, you can deposit assets to earn interest or borrow other assets using your holdings as collateral. Interest rates are determined dynamically by supply and demand.

q37.question: What is collateralization ratio?
q37.answer: The ratio of collateral required to borrow. For example, with 150% collateralization, you need to deposit 1.5 TB worth of collateral to borrow 1 TB worth. Falling below the maintenance ratio triggers liquidation.

q38.question: What is liquidation?
q38.answer: If the collateral value falls below the maintenance ratio due to price drops, part of the collateral is sold to repay the debt. Set a safe collateralization ratio and monitor regularly to prevent liquidation.

q39.question: What is yield farming?
q39.answer: Yield Farming is a strategy to maximize returns by depositing assets in various DeFi protocols. You can stake LP tokens or deposit single assets in different pools to earn reward tokens.

q40.question: How are APR and APY different?
q40.answer: APR is simple interest without compounding, while APY includes compound interest. For example, 10% APR with monthly compounding results in approximately 10.47% APY. Most DeFi displays APY for annual return reference.

q41.question: What is Cross-Chain Bridge?
q41.answer: A service that transfers assets from other blockchains (Ethereum, BSC, Polygon, etc.) to TBURN. Assets are locked on the original chain and equivalent tokens are minted on TBURN. Transfers take approximately 5-30 minutes.

q42.question: How do I use the bridge?
q42.answer: Select origin and destination chains on the Bridge page. Choose the token to transfer and enter the amount. After connecting your wallet, confirm the bridge transaction. Transferred assets are stored in an address with identical format.

q43.question: Is bridge security guaranteed?
q43.answer: TBURN Bridge uses multi-signature verification and AI risk assessment system. All transactions are verified by multiple validators and are monitored 24/7 for suspicious activity.

q44.question: What tokens can be bridged?
q44.answer: ETH, USDT, USDC, and major tokens are supported. The list of supported tokens expands continuously, and available tokens can be checked on the Bridge page.

q45.question: What is BTCfi?
q45.answer: BTCfi is DeFi using Bitcoin. Through TBURN, you can use wrapped BTC (wBTC) for staking, lending, and yield farming. Generate yield from BTC while maintaining its value.

q46.question: How do I mint NFTs on TBURN?
q46.answer: On the NFT Marketplace Launchpad page, you can create NFT collections. Upload images, enter metadata, set royalties, and deploy with one click. TBC-721 standard is used.

q47.question: How do I list NFTs for sale?
q47.answer: Click the NFT you want to sell on the Marketplace page and select "List". Set your price (fixed price or auction) and complete the listing with wallet signature. Royalties are automatically paid upon sale.

q48.question: How much are NFT marketplace fees?
q48.answer: Marketplace fees are 2.5% of sale price. Creators can set royalties (up to 10%) separately, which are automatically distributed on every resale.

q49.question: How do I participate in NFT Launchpad?
q49.answer: Launchpad allows early participation in new NFT projects. Connect your wallet, complete KYC if required, and participate during the minting period. Whitelist and public sale schedules are announced for each project.

q50.question: What NFT standards are supported?
q50.answer: TBC-721 (single NFT) and TBC-1155 (multi-edition NFT) standards are supported. Both support metadata extension and royalty configuration, and are compatible with EVM.

q51.question: What is GameFi?
q51.answer: GameFi is games with blockchain-based economies. You can own in-game items as NFTs and trade or stake game tokens. P2E (Play-to-Earn) model allows earning real value through play.

q52.question: How can I use TBURN in games?
q52.answer: Games built on TBURN allow you to earn rewards as TB or game tokens. Own in-game items as NFTs and trade them in the marketplace. Check the Game Tooling page for game integration methods.

q53.question: How is the game economy structured?
q53.answer: TBURN's game economy uses deflationary design. In-game consumption creates token burns, maintaining token value while running a sustainable game ecosystem.

q54.question: What are game development tools?
q54.answer: Game developers can integrate using TBURN SDK. Unity and Unreal Engine plugins are provided for easy NFT minting, token transfers, and wallet connections.

q55.question: What are in-game transaction fees?
q55.answer: In-game transactions also have TBURN network fees, but micro-transaction optimized gas costs are applied. Batch transaction processing can reduce fees.

q56.question: What is TBURN network performance?
q56.answer: TBURN processes 520,000 TPS with 100ms block time and approximately 0.8 second finality. The sharding architecture enables parallel processing, and performance can be verified on the network stats page.

q57.question: What is BFT consensus?
q57.answer: BFT (Byzantine Fault Tolerance) is a consensus algorithm that operates correctly even with up to 1/3 malicious nodes. TBURN uses AI-enhanced BFT for optimized validator selection and faster consensus.

q58.question: What is sharding?
q58.answer: A technique that divides the network into multiple sub-networks (shards) for parallel processing. Each shard processes transactions independently, dramatically increasing scalability. Cross-shard communication is secured through the beacon chain.

q59.question: How does RPC connection work?
q59.answer: Check the official RPC endpoint on the RPC Providers page. Enter the endpoint URL in wallet or dApp to connect. Multiple endpoints are available for redundancy and speed optimization.

q60.question: How do I check network status?
q60.answer: The Network Status page shows real-time TPS, block height, validator count, and latency. You can also check uptime of each node and network congestion.

q61.question: What are validator requirements?
q61.answer: Minimum 99.5% uptime, stable internet connection (100Mbps+), recommended 32GB RAM, 2TB SSD storage. Required staking amount varies by tier: Bronze 1,000 TB, Silver 10,000 TB, Gold 100,000 TB.

q62.question: What is developer documentation?
q62.answer: Technical documentation for developers is available in the Developer Hub. Includes smart contract development, SDK usage, API reference, and code examples. Updated regularly.

q63.question: What programming languages are supported?
q63.answer: Smart contracts support Solidity and Rust. SDKs are available for JavaScript/TypeScript, Python, Go, and Rust. Choose based on your development environment.

q64.question: How do I deploy smart contracts?
q64.answer: After developing a contract, deploy to testnet for testing first. Once testing is complete, deploy to mainnet through the deployment page. Contract verification and security audit are recommended.

q65.question: What SDK features are available?
q65.answer: The SDK supports wallet connection, transaction sending, smart contract interaction, event listening, staking, and NFT operations. Installation guide and code samples are provided in the documentation.

q66.question: How do I use the API?
q66.answer: The REST API and GraphQL API allow querying block/transaction data. WebSocket API provides real-time updates. API keys are managed on the API Keys page.

q67.question: What is EVM migration?
q67.answer: TBURN is EVM-compatible, allowing direct deployment of existing Ethereum contracts. Most Solidity code works as-is. Migration guides and tools are available on the EVM Migration page.

q68.question: What is the smart contract security audit?
q68.answer: Contracts integrated in mainnet should be security audited. Auditing partners detect vulnerabilities. Auditing process and certification methods are explained in the documentation.

q69.question: What is the Transaction Simulator?
q69.answer: The Transaction Simulator allows testing without executing real transactions. Verify the result before execution. Useful for gas estimation and error checking.

q70.question: How do I use the CLI?
q70.answer: The command-line interface tool is available for developers to deploy contracts, query information, and send transactions from the command line. Installation and commands are in the CLI Reference.

q71.question: What is WebSocket API?
q71.answer: WebSocket API provides real-time data streaming. Subscribe to new blocks, transactions, events, and receive instant notifications. Useful for building real-time applications.

q72.question: How do I check block details?
q72.answer: Enter the block number in Explorer to check the block's transaction list, proposer, timestamp, and gas used. Parent hash and state root can also be verified.

q73.question: How do I check address details?
q73.answer: Enter the address in Explorer to check balance, transaction history, token holdings, and contract information. Internal transactions and event logs are also displayed.

q74.question: How do I view token list?
q74.answer: The Tokens page in Explorer shows all tokens issued on the network. Check holders count, transfers, and market cap. Token contract verification status is also displayed.

q75.question: How do I verify contracts?
q75.answer: Publish source code on the contract verification page and match compilation settings for verification. Verified contracts show source code and ABI, enabling transparent interaction.

q76.question: How do I use testnet?
q76.answer: Switch to testnet network settings in your wallet. Get test TB from the Testnet Faucet and test as you would on mainnet. Testnet Explorer is separate from mainnet.

q77.question: What is the faucet?
q77.answer: Faucet provides free test tokens on testnet. Enter your wallet address to receive test TB within 24 hours. Use for development and testing.

q78.question: What is code example library?
q78.answer: The Code Examples page provides sample code for common use cases. Wallet connection, token transfers, staking integration, and NFT minting examples are available for learning.

q79.question: What is the Quick Start guide?
q79.answer: Explains the fastest way to get started with TBURN development. From SDK installation to first transaction, with step-by-step guidance. Perfect for beginners.

q80.question: Where can I report bugs?
q80.answer: Report bugs found through the Community Hub feedback. For critical security vulnerabilities, use the Bug Bounty program for rewards.

q81.question: What is governance?
q81.answer: TB token holders participate in decisions through voting. Vote on network upgrades, parameter changes, and fund allocation. Voting power is based on staking amount.

q82.question: How do I participate in voting?
q82.answer: View ongoing proposals in the Governance section and vote. Must stake TB to have voting power. Voting periods are typically 7-14 days.

q83.question: What is DePIN?
q83.answer: DePIN (Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Networks) tokenizes physical infrastructure like IoT devices and energy grids, enabling decentralized management and incentives.

q84.question: Where can I get test tokens?
q84.answer: You can get free test TB from the testnet faucet. Check the Testnet RPC page for faucet links and usage. Requests can be made every 24 hours.

q85.question: What are Actions & Blinks?
q85.answer: Actions & Blinks is a feature to share blockchain operations as URLs. Complex transactions can be shared and executed with a single link, simplifying user onboarding.

q86.question: What are token extensions?
q86.answer: TBC-20 tokens can be extended with additional features (freezing, transfer restrictions, interest, metadata). Used for security tokens or special-purpose tokens requiring compliance.

q87.question: What are permissioned blockchain solutions?
q87.answer: Enterprises can build private networks with access control. Based on TBURN technology, operate enterprise blockchains accessible only to authorized participants.

q88.question: What are Commerce solutions?
q88.answer: An integrated solution for accepting TB payments in online/offline stores. Provides payment API, POS integration, settlement system, and tax calculation tools.

q89.question: What financial solutions are available?
q89.answer: Provides custody, trading, payment, and asset management solutions for financial institutions. Compliance tools and audit trail features meet institutional requirements.

q90.question: What AI features are available?
q90.answer: Provides AI-based burn optimization, governance analysis, bridge risk assessment, anomaly detection, and validator scheduling. Multiple AI models (Gemini, Claude, ChatGPT, Grok) are integrated.

q91.question: What are enterprise use cases?
q91.answer: Provides enterprise blockchain use cases including supply chain tracking, digital certification, data integrity verification, and internal token systems. Dedicated support and SLA provided.

q92.question: What is tokenization?
q92.answer: Converting real assets (real estate, art, commodities) into blockchain tokens. Enables fractional ownership, increased liquidity, and 24/7 trading.

q93.question: Where can I check news and announcements?
q93.answer: Check the Community News page for latest updates, partnership announcements, and technical improvements. Subscribe to the newsletter to receive updates via email.

q94.question: How do I participate in events?
q94.answer: Check the Community Events page for ongoing airdrops, campaigns, and meetup information. Meet participation requirements and register to receive rewards.

q95.question: How do I make governance proposals?
q95.answer: Staking a certain amount of TB allows you to create governance proposals. Write content according to the proposal format and submit for community voting.

q96.question: What can I do on the Community Hub?
q96.answer: On the Community Hub, you can discuss with other users, introduce projects, and share feedback. You can also check official announcements and development updates.

q97.question: How do I keep my assets safe?
q97.answer: 1) Use hardware wallet, 2) Never share private key/seed phrase, 3) Beware of phishing sites, 4) Use only official URLs, 5) Enable 2FA. Store large assets in cold wallets.

q98.question: How do I identify scams?
q98.answer: Trust only official channels. Requests for private keys or seed phrases are 100% scams. Beware of messages creating urgency like "free tokens" or "urgent upgrade".

q99.question: What is the total supply of TB tokens?
q99.answer: Initial supply and current circulating supply of TB tokens can be checked on the Tokenomics page. Due to the burn mechanism, total supply continuously decreases.

q100.question: How does the burn mechanism work?
q100.answer: A 0.5% burn fee applies to all transfers, permanently burning that amount. Part of network fees are also burned. This deflationary model supports token value.

technicalWhitepaper.subtitle: Enterprise-Grade Layer 1 Blockchain with Quad-Band AI Orchestration

abstract.title: Abstract
abstract.p1: TBURN Chain is an enterprise-grade Layer 1 blockchain platform designed to address the fundamental limitations of existing blockchain networks: scalability, energy efficiency, and intelligent automation. By integrating a novel Trust Score-Based BFT Consensus, Dynamic Sharding Architecture, and Quad-Band AI Orchestration System, TBURN Chain achieves unprecedented throughput of 210,000+ TPS while maintaining decentralization and security guarantees.
abstract.p2: The platform introduces a deflationary tokenomics model with an AI-optimized burn mechanism, achieving a projected 30.6% token reduction over 20 years. TBURN Chain supports full EVM compatibility with quantum-resistant cryptographic extensions, enabling seamless migration for existing Ethereum applications while future-proofing against emerging computational threats.

architecture.title: System Architecture
architecture.intro: TBURN Chain employs a modular, layered architecture that separates concerns across execution, consensus, data availability, and settlement layers. This design enables independent scaling and upgradeability of each component.

execution.title: Execution Layer
execution.desc: The execution layer implements a fully EVM-compatible virtual machine with extensions for TBURN-specific opcodes. Transactions are processed in parallel across shards with deterministic state transitions.

consensus.title: Consensus Layer
consensus.desc: Trust Score-Based Byzantine Fault Tolerant (TS-BFT) consensus achieves finality within 1 second by weighting validator votes according to historical performance metrics, stake amount, and network contribution.

dataAvailability.title: Data Availability Layer
dataAvailability.desc: Each shard maintains its own state tree with cross-shard proofs enabling trustless verification. Archive nodes preserve complete historical data for audit and compliance requirements.

aiOrchestration.title: AI Orchestration Layer
aiOrchestration.desc: The Quad-Band AI system continuously monitors network health, optimizes resource allocation, detects anomalies, and executes governance decisions with minimal human intervention.

consensus.title: Trust Score-Based BFT Consensus
consensus.intro: TBURN Chain introduces an innovative consensus mechanism that extends traditional Byzantine Fault Tolerance with a dynamic trust scoring system.

trustScore.title: Trust Score Calculation
trustScore.desc: Each validator maintains a Trust Score (TS) calculated from multiple performance metrics:
trustScore.delta: Stake amount relative to network total
trustScore.epsilon: Cross-shard message relay and network health contribution

blockProduction.title: Block Production
blockProduction.desc: Validators are selected for block production through a weighted random selection algorithm.

finality.title: Finality Guarantee
finality.desc: TBURN Chain achieves single-slot finality through a two-phase commit process:
finality.proposeDesc: Selected proposer broadcasts block to shard validators
finality.commitDesc: Validators vote, 2/3+ weighted consensus confirms finality
finality.totalTime: Total finality time: 100ms per block, with cross-shard finality achieved within 1 second.

sharding.title: Dynamic Sharding Architecture
sharding.intro: TBURN Chain implements a dynamic sharding system that automatically scales from 5 to 128 shards based on network load and hardware capacity.

crossShard.title: Cross-Shard Communication
crossShard.desc: Cross-shard transactions utilize an asynchronous message passing protocol:
crossShard.messageQueueDesc: Priority-based routing with O(1) shard pair selection
crossShard.batchProcessingDesc: Messages aggregated into batches for efficiency
crossShard.proofGenerationDesc: Merkle proofs enable trustless cross-shard verification
crossShard.cachingDesc: 30-second TTL shard state cache for optimal performance

autoScaling.title: Automatic Scaling
autoScaling.desc: The sharding engine monitors network load in real-time:
autoScaling.scaleUpDesc: When average shard load exceeds 70% for 5 minutes
autoScaling.scaleDownDesc: When average shard load drops below 30% for 15 minutes
autoScaling.rebalanceDesc: When load imbalance exceeds 30% between shards

aiSystem.title: Quad-Band AI Orchestration System
aiSystem.intro: TBURN Chain integrates a sophisticated AI orchestration layer that continuously optimizes network operations, security, and governance.

failFast.title: Fail-Fast Architecture
failFast.desc: The AI system implements a fail-fast architecture with automatic fallback.

burnOptimization.title: Burn Optimization Algorithm
burnOptimization.desc: The AI-driven burn mechanism analyzes network activity to optimize token burning:

faq1.question: What is TBURN Chain and why should I invest?
faq1.answer: TBURN Chain is a next-generation Layer-1 blockchain with AI-based dynamic sharding technology. With 64 shards and 125 genesis validators, it targets 210,000 TPS and 100ms block time. It combines deflationary tokenomics with AI governance for long-term value growth. Seed investors can participate at $0.04, an 80% discount from public sale, and enjoy early investor benefits as the network grows.

faq2.question: What are the seed round investment terms and vesting schedule?
faq2.answer: The seed round is priced at $0.04 per token, with 500M TBURN (5% of total supply) allocated. Hardcap is $20M. Vesting: 12-month cliff after TGE, followed by 24-month linear unlock. 5% unlocks at cliff end, then ~3.96% monthly. Designed to ensure network stability through long-term holding.

faq3.question: What are the minimum/maximum investment amounts and how are investor tiers structured?
faq3.answer: The seed round has 3 tiers: (1) Angel Tier: $25,000-$99,999, basic allocation and monthly investor newsletter (2) Strategic Tier: $100,000-$499,999, 10% bonus tokens and quarterly team meetings (3) Lead Tier: $500,000+, 20% bonus tokens, advisor board participation, monthly project update calls. KYC verification required for all tiers.

faq4.question: What is the investment process and required documents?
faq4.answer: Process: (1) Investment inquiry â†’ (2) NDA and Letter of Intent â†’ (3) KYC/AML verification (passport/ID, address proof, source of funds) â†’ (4) SAFT contract â†’ (5) Fund transfer (USDT, USDC, or bank wire) â†’ (6) Token allocation confirmation. Typically 7-14 business days with dedicated manager support. Separate arrangements available for institutional investors.

faq5.question: What is a SAFT contract and how are investors protected?
faq5.answer: SAFT (Simple Agreement for Future Tokens) is a standard investment contract complying with US SEC guidelines. It specifies token allocation, vesting schedule, investor rights, refund conditions, and dispute resolution. Funds are held in third-party escrow, released based on milestone achievement. Legal counsel by global law firm Dentons, with quarterly financial reports provided to investors.

faq6.question: What are the token listing plans and expected timeline?
faq6.answer: TGE (Token Generation Event) is planned alongside mainnet launch. Listing strategy: First, liquidity provision on major DEXs (Uniswap, PancakeSwap), then Tier-1 CEX listings (Binance, OKX, Bybit, etc.) with marketing boost and gradual exchange expansion. Launch price is expected at $0.50 (12.5x from seed), subject to market conditions.

faq7.question: How will the funds be used?
faq7.answer: Seed round fund allocation: Technology Development 45% (core protocol, AI engine, security infrastructure), Marketing & Partnerships 25% (global marketing, strategic partnerships, community building), Operations & Legal 15% (team operations, legal/compliance, office), Liquidity 10% (DEX/CEX initial liquidity), Reserve 5% (emergency fund, market opportunities). Quarterly fund usage reports provided to investors.

faq8.question: What is the refund policy and can I cancel my investment?
faq8.answer: Full refund available before SAFT contract signing. After signing, refunds only possible for project discontinuation, mainnet launch failure, or legal issues. 100% principal returned with ~30 business days processing. Mid-term cancellation for personal reasons not permitted. Please invest carefully. Detailed refund terms in SAFT contract.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Check answers to common questions about the airdrop

q1.question: What is the total airdrop amount and distribution structure?
q1.answer: 300 million TBURN is distributed as airdrop (3% of total 10 billion TBURN supply). Distribution: (1) Genesis Airdrop 150M TBURN - for testnet participants, NFT holders, early birds (2) Community Airdrop 100M TBURN - point-based distribution for social tasks, referrals (3) Loyalty Airdrop 50M TBURN - for long-term holders and staking participants (starts 90 days after TGE).

q2.question: How much can I receive at TGE?
q2.answer: 15% of total allocation is immediately claimable at TGE (Token Generation Event). The remaining 85% vests linearly at ~9.4% monthly over 9 months. TGE is scheduled for February 2026.

q3.question: How are points converted to tokens?
q3.answer: Tokens are distributed based on your point ratio compared to total participant points. Formula: My allocation = (My points / Total points pool) Ã— Total airdrop amount.

q4.question: Which wallets are supported?
q4.answer: TBURN Chain is EVM-compatible and supports various wallets. Supported: MetaMask (recommended), Trust Wallet, Coinbase Wallet, Rainbow Wallet, Rabby Wallet, Ledger/Trezor hardware wallets.

q5.question: How do I claim the airdrop?
q5.answer: After TGE, the Claim button will activate on this page. Claim process: (1) Connect wallet (2) Click claim button (3) Sign transaction and pay gas fee (4) Tokens automatically sent to wallet.

q6.question: How many points do I get for completing tasks?
q6.answer: Points per task: Required - Wallet connect (500P), Email verify (300P), Telegram join (400P). Social - X follow (200P), Retweet (300P), Discord join (400P). Bonus - Genesis NFT (2,000P), Friend invite (max 5,000P), Testnet (3,000P).

q7.question: How does the NFT holder bonus work?
q7.answer: TBURN Genesis NFT holders receive a 2x multiplier on their airdrop allocation. NFT verification is automatic upon wallet connection.

q8.question: Are there restricted regions or conditions?
q8.answer: Some regions restricted for regulatory compliance. Restricted: USA, China, North Korea, Iran, Syria, Cuba and other OFAC sanctioned countries.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about the referral program

q1.question: What is the total referral rewards pool?
q1.answer: The referral program total rewards pool is 300M TBURN. This represents 3% of the total 10 billion TBURN supply. 5% (15M TBURN) is unlocked at TGE, and the remaining 95% vests linearly over 36 months at approximately 2.64% per month. About 42M TBURN has been distributed to referrers so far.

q2.question: How is commission calculated?
q2.answer: You receive commission from fees generated when your referrals trade, stake, bridge, etc. on TBURN Chain. The base trading fee is 0.1%, and you receive 20-50% of that fee as commission based on your tier. Example: If a referral trades $1,000 â†’ $1 fee generated â†’ Gold tier (40%) earns $0.40

q3.question: How do I increase my tier?
q3.answer: Your tier automatically increases based on the number of friends you invite. Bronze (0-9, 20%), Silver (10-49, 30%), Gold (50-199, 40%), Diamond (200+, 50%). Higher tiers unlock not only higher commission rates but also multi-tier referral benefits (2nd level, 3rd level).

q4.question: When can I receive rewards?
q4.answer: Referral rewards are credited in real-time, and accumulated rewards can be withdrawn anytime. Minimum withdrawal is 100 TBURN, with a small gas fee (~0.001 TBURN) deducted. Withdrawals are sent instantly to your connected wallet.

q5.question: What is multi-tier referral?
q5.answer: Multi-tier referral allows you to earn commission not only from people you directly invite (1st level) but also from their referrals (2nd level) and beyond (3rd level). Silver+ unlocks 2nd level (5-10%), Diamond unlocks 3rd level (15%).

q6.question: Where do I get my referral link?
q6.answer: Connect your wallet to automatically generate a unique referral link and code. Check your dashboard to view and easily share on Twitter, Telegram, Discord, KakaoTalk, etc. Supported wallets: MetaMask, Rabby, Trust Wallet, Coinbase Wallet, Ledger

q7.question: Can I refer to anyone anywhere?
q7.answer: Referrals are available globally, but some restricted regions (OFAC sanctioned countries) are excluded. Check the eligibility section for details.

q8.question: How is anti-fraud protected?
q8.answer: The system monitors for fraud such as self-referral, Sybil attacks, and fake accounts. Detected fraudulent activities will result in immediate account termination and forfeiture of all rewards.

faq.subtitle: Find answers to common event-related questions

q1.question: What is the total event reward pool?
q1.answer: The total event reward pool is 400M TBURN, which is 4% of the total supply of 10B TBURN. It is distributed across 5 categories: Launch Events (100M, 25%), Trading Competition (100M, 25%), Staking Boost (80M, 20%), Community Challenge (60M, 15%), Partnership (60M, 15%).

q2.question: Who can participate in events?
q2.answer: Anyone who connects their wallet can participate. Supported wallets: MetaMask, Rabby, Trust Wallet, Coinbase Wallet, Ledger. Some events may require KYC verification or specific conditions. Check participation requirements on each event card.

q3.question: When are rewards distributed?
q3.answer: Most event rewards are distributed within 7 days after the event ends. Ongoing events are distributed every Monday at UTC 00:00. Trading competition rewards are distributed within 3 days after final rankings are confirmed.

q4.question: Can I participate in multiple events simultaneously?
q4.answer: Yes, you can participate in all concurrent events. The more events you join, the more rewards you can earn!

q5.question: How are trading competition rankings determined?
q5.answer: Rankings are determined by: 1) Volume Ranking - Based on total trading volume (USD), 2) Profit Ranking - Based on portfolio profit rate (%). Each ranking has a separate reward pool.

q6.question: How is the staking boost APY calculated?
q6.answer: During the Staking Boost Event (first 30 days), 2x the base APY is applied. Additional bonuses: +5% for 1,000+ TBURN, +10% for 10,000+ TBURN.

q7.question: How are meme contest winners selected?
q7.answer: Meme Contest proceeds in 2 stages: 1) Community Voting - Top 20 selected, 2) Judge Evaluation - Final winners selected based on creativity, relevance, and viral potential.

q8.question: What happens if fraud is detected?
q8.answer: If fraud is detected, all event rewards will be confiscated and the account permanently banned from all future events. AI-based fraud detection monitors 24/7.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Common questions about the community program

q1.question: What is the total reward pool for the Community Program?
q1.answer: The total Community Program reward pool is 300 million TBURN. This represents 3% of the total supply of 10 billion TBURN. It is distributed across 6 programs: Ambassador (30%), Content Creator (20%), Moderator (15%), Education Expert (15%), Translator (10%), and Bug Bounty (10%).

q2.question: How do I participate in the Community Program?
q2.answer: Click the 'Apply' button on each program card to submit your application. After review and approval, you can start your activities as an official community member. Ambassadors go through an additional interview process.

q3.question: How are points converted to TBURN?
q3.answer: Points are automatically converted to TBURN at the end of each month. Conversion rates vary by tier, with Legend tier receiving up to 3x reward multiplier. Converted TBURN is distributed in the first week of the following month.

q4.question: Can I participate in multiple programs?
q4.answer: Yes, you can participate in multiple programs simultaneously. For example, you can earn rewards as both an Ambassador and Content Creator. However, you must meet all requirements for each program.

q5.question: How does the tier system work?
q5.answer: There are 5 tier levels: Newcomer (1x) â†’ Contributor (1.2x) â†’ Advocate (1.5x) â†’ Champion (2x) â†’ Legend (3x). Earn points through activities to advance to higher tiers, with increasing reward multipliers. Legend tier requires 10,000+ points.

q6.question: What are the demotion conditions?
q6.answer: If you fail to meet the minimum activity requirement (100+ points per month) for 3 consecutive months, you may be demoted. Demotion occurs one tier at a time, and the corresponding tier's reward multiplier will apply.

q7.question: How are bug bounty rewards determined?
q7.answer: Bug bounty rewards are determined by severity: Critical (up to 50,000 TBURN), High (10,000-25,000 TBURN), Medium (2,000-10,000 TBURN), Low (500-2,000 TBURN). Payment is made within 7 days after security expert verification.

q8.question: What are the content quality standards?
q8.answer: Content is evaluated on 4 criteria: accuracy, originality, quality, and engagement. Plagiarism, misinformation, or low-quality content will be rejected, and repeated violations may result in program suspension. Excellent content is promoted on official channels with additional bonuses.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about becoming a TBURN validator

q1.question: What is an external validator?
q1.answer: An external validator is a node operator who runs validator software to participate in TBURN network consensus. Validators verify transactions, produce blocks, and help secure the network in exchange for rewards.

q2.question: How much TBURN do I need to stake?
q2.answer: The minimum stake varies by tier: Genesis requires 5,000,000 TBURN, Pioneer requires 1,000,000 TBURN, Standard requires 500,000 TBURN, and Community requires 100,000 TBURN.

q3.question: What are the hardware requirements?
q3.answer: You need a server with at least 8 CPU cores, 32GB RAM, 2TB NVMe SSD storage, and a 1Gbps network connection. Enterprise-grade hardware is recommended for optimal performance.

q4.question: How are rewards calculated?
q4.answer: Rewards are based on your stake amount, tier level, uptime, and block production performance. Higher tiers receive priority in reward distribution and bonus multipliers.

q5.question: What happens if my validator goes offline?
q5.answer: Extended downtime may result in slashing penalties and reduced rewards. Validators are expected to maintain 99.9% uptime. We recommend setting up monitoring and alerts.

q6.question: How do I get support?
q6.answer: Genesis and Pioneer validators receive dedicated support channels. All validators can access community forums, documentation, and our Discord support server.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Common questions about TBURN DAO governance

items.question: How do I participate in governance?
items.answer: Connect your wallet and stake TBURN tokens to receive vTBURN voting power.

items.question: What is the minimum stake required?
items.answer: You need at least 100 TBURN to participate in voting.

items.question: How long is the voting period?
items.answer: Standard proposals have a 5-day voting period.

items.question: Can I delegate my voting power?
items.answer: Yes, you can delegate to any address without transferring your tokens.
